shared.model

Class Fascade

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.model.Fascade

  • public class Fascade
extends java.lang.Object
    The Facade class handles all communication and commands to and from the game model.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • getPlayerColorByIndex

        public java.lang.String getPlayerColorByIndex(int player_index)
        Orders the construction of a road on that edge.
        Parameters:
        request -
        player_index -
        Pre-Conditions
        canBuildRoad() returns true
        Post-Conditions
        a road is built for that player on that edge. The server is notified., The player's resources are reduced by 1 wood and 1 brick

        Tells whether a specified PlayerInfo can buy a Development card right now.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Pre-Conditions
        None
        Post-Conditions
        result = True when the player can afford a development card and it is their turn to buy things. /result = false otherwise.

                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Buy a development card
        Parameters:
        player -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Pre-Conditions
        PlayerInfo can buy a development card (see previous function)
        Post-Conditions
        the player has a new development card., The player's resources are reduced by 1 food and 1 ore and 1 wool

        Post-Conditions

      • buildSettlement

        public void buildSettlement(int player_index,
                   Vertex location)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Build a settlement on that spot
        Parameters:
        player -
        location -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Pre-Conditions
        canBuildSettlement() is true
        Post-Conditions
        a settlement is built by that player on the specified location, The player's resources are reduced by 1 food, 1 brick, 1 wood, and 1 wool

        Throws:

        Post-Conditions

      • RollDice

        public int RollDice(int player_index)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Roll the dice and apply the consequences
        Parameters:
        player -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Pre-Conditions
        canRollDice() is true
        Post-Conditions
        the dice are rolled and the consequences are applied to each player and the game state is advanced to the next turn phase

      • discardResources

        public DataResponse discardResources(ResourceMultiSet discard_list)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        discard_list -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Pre-Conditions
        the player was forced by a rolled 7 to discard half and generated a list of half his resources to discard
        Post-Conditions
        the chosen resources are returned to the game bank

      • whoCanBeRobbed

        public Player[] whoCanBeRobbed(HexLocation hexLoc,
                      int player_index)

        Pre-Conditions
        none
        Post-Conditions
        result = an array of indexes to the players that can be robbed. Or an empty array if none are possible

      • rob

        public DataResponse rob(int robber,
               int robbed)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Rob the indicated player of a random card
        Parameters:
        robber -
        robbed -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Pre-Conditions
        The player is in the rob phase of their turn and have not yet robbed, robber != robbed
        Post-Conditions
        The robbed player has one resource taken and given to the robber player at random., the turn phase is advanced

      • canTradeAtMiscHarbor

        public boolean canTradeAtMiscHarbor(int player_index,
                           ResourceMultiSet trade_in_cards)

        desired_cards -

      • tradeAtMiscHarbor

        public DataResponse tradeAtMiscHarbor(int player,
                             ResourceMultiSet trade_in_cards,
                             ResourceMultiSet desired_card)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        use the 3-to-1 trade at a miscilaneous harbor
        Parameters:
        trade_in_card -
        desired_card -
        player -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Pre-Conditions
        canTradeAtMiscHarbor() is true. The trade-in list has only 3 of the same resourse to trade in, the desired card is a list of a single card different from what they traded in
        Post-Conditions
        the player's resources are reduced by those 3 resources and increased by 1 of the desired card.

      • canTradeFourToOne

        public boolean canTradeFourToOne(int player_index,
                        ResourceMultiSet trade_in_cards,
                        ResourceMultiSet desired_cards)

        Parameters:
        player -
        trade_in_card -
        desired_cards -
        Pre-Conditions
        none
        Post-Conditions

      • tradeFourToOne

        public DataResponse tradeFourToOne(int player,
                          ResourceMultiSet trade_in_card,
                          ResourceMultiSet desired_card)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        use the 4-to-1 trade
        Parameters:
        trade_in_card -
        desired_card -
        player -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Pre-Conditions
        canTradeFourToOne() is true. The trade in has only 4 of the same resourse to trade in, the desired card is a list with a single card different from what they traded in
        Post-Conditions
        the player's resources are reduced by those 4 resources and increased by 1 of the desired card.

      • whoLongestRoad

        public int whoLongestRoad()
        Who has the longest road? This info is stored in the turn-tracker class The idea for this function came from another group in another section who were penalized for not having this in their design
        Pre-Conditions
        none
        Post-Conditions
        result = the player index with the most roads played or -1 if nobody controlls that honor

      • whoLargestArmy

        public int whoLargestArmy()
        Who has the largest army? This info is stored in the turn-tracker class The idea for this function came from another group in another section who were penalized for not having this in their design
        Pre-Conditions
        none
        Post-Conditions
        result = the player index with the largest army or -1 if nobody controls that honor

        player_index -
        to_discard -
        Pre-Conditions
        none
        Post-Conditions
        True iff the player is in the discard phase and has these cards

      • getModel

        the model was updated
        Post-Conditions
        the facasde points to this new model

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        Tells all observers to update to the current model
        Pre-Conditions
        the model was updated
        Post-Conditions
        all observers know to query for the new model information
